Neural networks¶

Neural Network model under POM1.

class MMLL.models.POM1.NeuralNetworks.neural_network.NN_Master(comms, logger, verbose=False, model_architecture=None, Nmaxiter=10, learning_rate=0.0001, momentum=0, nesterov=False, model_averaging='True', optimizer='adam', loss='categorical_crossentropy', metric='accuracy', batch_size=32, num_epochs=1, Tmax=None)¶

Bases: MMLL.models.POM1.CommonML.POM1_CommonML.POM1_CommonML_Master

This class implements Neural Networks, run at Master node. It inherits from POM1_CommonML_Master.

Create a NN_Master instance.

Parameters

  • comms (Comms_master) – Object providing communication functionalities.

  • logger (mylogging.Logger) – Logging object instance.

  • verbose (boolean) – Indicates whether to print messages on screen nor not.

  • model_architecture (JSON) – JSON containing the neural network architecture as defined by Keras (in model.to_json()).

  • Nmaxiter (int) – Maximum number of communication rounds.

  • learning_rate (float) – Learning rate for training.

  • momentum (float) – Optimizer momentum.

  • Nesterov (boolean) – Flag indicating if the momentum optimizer is Nesterov or not.

  • model_averaging (boolean) – Whether to use model averaging (True) or gradient averaging (False).

  • optimizer (string) – Type of optimizer to use (should be one from https://keras.io/api/optimizers/).

  • loss (string) – Type of loss to use (should be one from https://keras.io/api/losses/).

  • metric (string) – Type of metric to use (should be one from https://keras.io/api/metrics/).

  • batch_size (int) – Size of the batch to use for training in each worker locally.

  • num_epochs (int) – Number of epochs to train in each worker locally before sending the result to the master.

  • Tmax (float) – Maximum execution time in seconds.

ProcessReceivedPacket_Master_(packet, sender)¶

Process the received packet at master.

Parameters

  • packet (dictionary) – Packet received from a worker.

  • sender (string) – Identification of the sender.

TakeAction_Master()¶

Function to take actions according to the state.

Parameters

None –

Update_State_Master()¶

Function to control the state of the execution.

Parameters

None –

class MMLL.models.POM1.NeuralNetworks.neural_network.NN_Worker(master_address, comms, logger, verbose=False, Xtr_b=None, ytr=None)¶

Bases: MMLL.models.POM1.CommonML.POM1_CommonML.POM1_CommonML_Worker

Class implementing Neural Networks, run at Worker node. It inherits from POM1_CommonML_Worker.

Create a NN_Worker instance.

Parameters

  • master_address (string) – Identifier of the master instance.

  • comms (Comms_worker) – Object providing communication functionalities.

  • logger (mylogging.Logger) – Logging object instance.

  • verbose (boolean) – Indicates whether to print messages on screen nor not.

  • Xtr_b (ndarray) – Array containing the inputs for training.

  • ytr (ndarray) – Array containing the labels for training.

ProcessReceivedPacket_Worker(packet)¶

Process the received packet at worker.

Parameters

packet (dictionary) – Packet received from the master.

get_weight_grad(model_weights, num_data=None)¶

Get gradients of the model.

Parameters

  • model_weights (list of numpy arrays) – Actual weights of the model as returned by Keras model.get_weights().

  • num_data (int) – Size of the batch.

Returns

output_grad – Gradients of the model.

Return type

list of numpy arrays

class MMLL.models.POM1.NeuralNetworks.neural_network.NN_model(logger, model_architecture, optimizer='Adam', loss='categorical_crossentropy', metric='accuracy')¶

Bases: MMLL.models.Common_to_models.Common_to_models

This class contains the neural network model in the format defined by Keras.

Create a NN_model instance.

Parameters

  • logger (mylogging.Logger) – Logging object instance.

  • model_architecture (JSON) – Neural network architecture as defined by Keras (in model.to_json()).

  • optimizer (string) – Type of optimizer to use (must be one from https://keras.io/api/optimizers/).

  • loss (string) – Type of loss to use (must be one from https://keras.io/api/losses/).

  • metric (string) – Type of metric to use (must be one from https://keras.io/api/metrics/).

predict(X_b)¶

Uses the neural network model to predict new outputs given the inputs.

Parameters

X_b (ndarray) – Array containing the input patterns.

Returns

preds – Array containing the predictions.

Return type

ndarray

MMLL.models.POM1.NeuralNetworks.neural_network.seed(self, seed=None)¶

Reseed a legacy MT19937 BitGenerator

Notes

This is a convenience, legacy function.

The best practice is to not reseed a BitGenerator, rather to recreate a new one. This method is here for legacy reasons. This example demonstrates best practice.

>>> from numpy.random import MT19937
>>> from numpy.random import RandomState, SeedSequence
>>> rs = RandomState(MT19937(SeedSequence(123456789)))
# Later, you want to restart the stream
>>> rs = RandomState(MT19937(SeedSequence(987654321)))
